sentences.cn: 艾伦伸伸懒腰，打了个呵欠。
听得见我打呵欠的声音 么 ?

sentences.en: He smothered a yawn behind his hand.
sentences.cn: 他用手挡住嘴遮掩自己打哈欠.

sentences.en: Her yawn suggests that she is sleepy.
sentences.cn: 她打哈欠表示她很困了.

sentences.en: Her yawn was a Pavlovian response to my yawn.
sentences.cn: 她打哈欠是对我打哈欠的条件反射。

sentences.en: Kay shook her head and stifled a yawn (= tried to stop yawning ).

sentences.cn: 罗莎娜想打个大哈欠，但强忍住了。

sentences.en: She let out a big yawn a full inch square in area.
sentences.cn: 柔嘉打个面积一寸见方的大呵欠.

sentences.en: She makes no attempt to stifle a yawn.
She managed to stifle a yawn.
She stretched her arms out and gave a great yawn.
sentences.cn: 她伸了个懒腰，打了个大哈欠。

sentences.en: The alarm did go off but all I did was yawn, turn over and go back to sleep.
sentences.cn: 闹钟确实响了，但我只是打了个哈欠，翻个身又接着睡着了。

sentences.en: The concert was a predictable yawn.
sentences.cn: 果不其然，那场音乐会很乏味。

sentences.en: The debate was a mockery. A big yawn.
sentences.cn: 这场辩论实在可笑。简直是无聊透顶。

sentences.en: The meeting was one big yawn from start to finish.
sentences.cn: 那会议自始至终十分无聊.

sentences.en: The play was a big yawn from start to finish.
sentences.cn: 那出戏从头至尾极其乏味.

trans.tran_en: to open your mouth wide and breathe in deeply because you are tired or bored
to open your mouth wide and breathe in deeply because you are tired or bored
